Key Match Events: Canada beat Ireland by 12 runs in New York for their first win in the T20 World Cup
Ireland was bowled out for 125/7 in 20 overs
Canada scored 137/7 in 20 overs
Canada's Shreyas Movva scored 37 runs off 36 balls
Canada's Nicholas Kirton scored 49 runs off 35 balls
Ireland's Paul Stirling was bowled by Jeremy Gordon for 9 runs off 17 balls
Ireland's Curtis Campher was caught by Johnson for 4 runs off 7 balls
Ireland's Lorcan Tucker was run out for 4 runs off 10 balls
Ireland's Andy Balbirnie scored 4 runs off 5 balls
Canada's Dilpreet Bajwa was caught by Delany for 7 runs off 9 balls
Canada's Pargat Singh was caught by Little for 18 runs off 14 balls
Canada's Johnson was caught by Campher for 6 runs off 10 balls
Ireland's Harry Tector was bowled by Saad Zafar for 0 runs off 2 balls
Ireland's Balbirnie was caught by Heyliger for 4 runs off 2 balls
Canada's Kirton and Movva added 50 runs off 44 balls
Canada's Kirton hit a six and a four off Gareth Delany's over

Pre-Game Insights: Ireland won the toss and elected to bowl
The pitch was expected to be sluggish due to heavy rain overnight
The square boundaries were skewed, with one 62 metres long and the other 73 metres
A lot of grass had been taken off, and the pitch looked much whiter
The conditions had not suited batting one bit, with the 100-run mark not yet breached in two games
Sri Lanka was bowled out for 77 runs, and South Africa huffed and puffed to chase them down in 16.2 overs
Ireland was bowled out for 96 against India, and the Men in Blue took a few hits on the body due to uneven bounce
The International Cricket Council (ICC) had issued a statement over the criticism of the drop-in pitch at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York
